p.s: In the dialogue, ShakespearShakespeare used a variety of rhetorical devices as metaphors or comparisons and wrote it with a clear sentence structure.
Also you can find aspects in the text giving hints about the relationship of Macbeth and Lady Macbeth.
The dominant part of their relationship is clearly Lady Macbeth.
The first reason for that assertion is the share of speech in the dialogue.
Lady Macbeth talks way more than Macbeth.
Also she mostly has a complex sentence structure for example in lines 39 to 44 When Duncan [...] limback only which expresses her dominance and intellegenceintelligence.
Further on it seems like she is using her husband to get that much power she wants to get.
Lady Macbeth is the bad part of their relationship, by looking at that extract, as you can see that she tries to convince him of a murder even if he decided to not execute the plan.
To convince her husband of murdering kingKing Duncan Lady Macbeth uses a variation of stylistic devices.
At her first try to persuade Macbeth she appeals to his hope and for that she uses a personification Hath it slept since? (l. 10) and also in line 9 Was the hope drunk.
So with the help of that she is trying to bring back the hope to become King with rhetorical devices.
Furthermore, in the same part of the dialogue she is using many questions, like the ones I mentioned before, to make Macbeth overthink his decision of cancelling the plan.
Lady Macbeth uses metaphors as well.
For example in line 25 What beast, which is supposed to help her to wake up the bad and murdering side of Macbeth.
Another metaphor with the same intention, but more aggressive is But screw your courage to the sticking place (l. 38).
The metaphor is also something like an introduction to present her plan at Macbeth how they could kill kingKing Duncan.
To express that the chmaberlains won't be a danger after she made them drunk she uses a comparison as in death (l. 46).
All thisthese rhetorical devices in combination with the dominant sentence structure and a well overthought choice of words she is able to convince Macbeth of the murdering of kingKing Duncan.

To show his opinion about that and to express his feelings, Macbeth ends the scene with the words False face must hide what the false heart doth know (l. 56) which is also a parallelism and a contrast.
AlltogetherAltogetherLady Macbeth seems to have a strong personality that helps her getting Macbeth to do whatever she wants him to do.
For that she is able to use rhetorical devices very reasoned.
